bugs.title: CVE-2021-20279 moodle: Stored XSS via ID number user profile field [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-20279 moodle: Stored XSS via ID number user profile field [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-20279 moodle: Stored XSS via ID number user profile field

long_desc.thetext:
The ID number user profile field required additional sanitizing to prevent a stored XSS risk.

References:

https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=419650

External References:

https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=419650

Created moodle tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1939034]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1939035]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

Mitigation:

Disable the ID number field by unchecking it in Site admin > Users > User policies > Show user identity, until the patch has been applied.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update

bugs.title: CVE-2021-20280 moodle: Stored XSS and blind SSRF possible via feedback answer text [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-20280 moodle: Stored XSS and blind SSRF possible via feedback answer text [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-20280 moodle: Stored XSS and blind SSRF possible via feedback answer text

long_desc.thetext:
Text-based feedback answers required additional sanitizing to prevent stored XSS and blind SSRF risks.

References:

https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=419651

External References:

https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=419651

bugs.title: CVE-2021-20281 moodle: User full name disclosure within online users block [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-20281 moodle: User full name disclosure within online users block [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-20281 moodle: User full name disclosure within online users block

long_desc.thetext:
It was possible for some users without permission to view other users' full names to do so via the online users block.

References:

https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=419652

External References:

https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=419652

bugs.title: CVE-2021-20282 moodle: Bypass email verification secret when confirming account registration [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-20282 moodle: Bypass email verification secret when confirming account registration [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-20282 moodle: Bypass email verification secret when confirming account registration

long_desc.thetext:
When creating a user account, it was possible to verify the account without having access to the verification email link/secret.

References:

https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=419653

External References:

https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=419653

bugs.title: CVE-2021-20283 moodle: Fetching a user's enrolled courses via web services did not check profile access in each course [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-20283 moodle: Fetching a user's enrolled courses via web services did not check profile access in each course [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-20283 moodle: Fetching a user's enrolled courses via web services did not check profile access in each course

long_desc.thetext:
The web service responsible for fetching other users' enrolled courses did not validate that the requesting user had permission to view that information in each course.

References:

https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=419654

External References:

https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=419654
